storyInfo: The mysterious Seaborn descends on the city. Kal'tsit and the others learn of the Church of the Deep's origins, and more of the truth behind the Seaborn. Gladiia hastens for the city, but fails to save Ulpianus. He has already separated the tower-turned-nest from the city, and sunk with it into the abyss.

attributes.content: Long have you walked the land, Kal'tsit. The changes in the sky would not have escaped your attention.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The Seaborn raises its head slightly, gazing up with its non-existent eyes. Perhaps a habit from the time it still had them.
Above the dome, beyond the infinite water, something in the distance seems to have caught its attention.
Tell me, how long will it take for the hole to close again?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Ægir was right. The Seaborn had a clear reason for leaving the ocean and invading the land.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You came because you noticed the change in the barrier.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I have seen through the eyes of we many who have ventured on land.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: There is a ripple in the sky. The immutable veil has been torn open.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Your survival instincts have driven you to monitor every change in the environment... and the dangers they signify.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dangers? Yes.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You are indeed sharp, Kal'tsit. Your program runs smoothly.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Our communication will be, effective.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The calamity that hangs above Terra. The eye that gazes upon us. Does it see the abnormality of the sky? Or has it already...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You understand Terra, Kal'tsit, and the crisis it faces.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You can. You must. Help we many understand, help we many evolve.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.options: Am I hearing this correctly, Kal'tsit?;Rhodes Island came to eliminate you.

attributes.content: I sincerely hope this is the Seaborn's wishful thinking, rather than some kind of consensus you have, Dr. Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Let it finish, Madame Consul.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The last chance is fleeting. The oceans of Terra are too small.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Knowledge. Nourishment. Space. We many must grow. We many require help.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.options: You're not just trying to go on land?;You want to go into space?

attributes.content: Growing wings is not difficult, but insufficient. Going beyond the skies requires a revolution in the species' fundamental nature.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You have the knowledge, Kal'tsit. You help we many understand, and we overcome calamity.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Whatever their origin, the Seaborn are non-sapient creatures driven by instinct, ones that the Church fanatics have placed their unreasonable expectations on.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But you know far more than either of those two groups possibly could. How?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We are the same, Kal'tsit. You and we many, have the same duty.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Perhaps I should reframe the question...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: How did the Seaborn evolve into what they are today? What do you have to do with Caerula Arbor going out of control?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Is the answer important to you?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: I can speak of my own history, if it helps you understand my intention.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: ...We've waited two centuries for these answers.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: What really happened in that failed expedition? What turned you into what you are now?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Failed? No. It was a success beyond our wildest dreams.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: We penetrated the deepest layer of the mantle ruins for the first time.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The Predecessors carved open the rock and built massive, maze-like complexes reaching into the lower mantle. We'd never gone further than them, even after thousands of years of excavating.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The mantle ruins, the genesis of Ægir civilization. We thought we'd find more relics, more secrets, more answers there.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: But all we had hoped for did not exist. All that was buried in those depths was a spark of hope.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: ...Go on.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I was separated from my team along the way. I was the only one to make it to the end of the path.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: There, I saw...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: A giant. Some massive thing sleeping in the shadow of the cerulean tree.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: I did not see His entirety. A small part of His limb was enough to fill my entire vision.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: That limb was touching the transparent wall of a sealed chamber. Perhaps He was waiting for contact, or perhaps...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Before I realized it, I was standing before Him and reaching out.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The wall of the chamber was cold, but I could feel His warmth. Then, visions surged towards me from every direction, inundating me.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: A Feranmut shared its vision with you. What did you see?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Fallen cities under an oppressively hanging dome, the land aflame, the stargate extinguished, the Star Ring broken, the road network shattered...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The destruction of prehistoric civilization?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes. Ægir never discovered the reason for its destruction, but I saw a vision of it before my eyes.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Yet it was not the end. Visions continued to flow, visions far beyond my limited comprehension.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Eternally dispersing particles and oceans of sand that never ripple...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Cold, lightless plains and darkness without end...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Burnt-out stars and ever-expanding black holes...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Nothing there was familiar. I lost my senses, all of them, and even the Feranmut that shared vision with me could not sense His own existence...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: It was an entirely alien place, without life, meaning, or information—
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The Seaborn's words stop. Through its transparent skull, you can see the strangely colored nuclei gather, then disperse.
It seems to be thinking, and the nuclei represent the process of its thoughts.
But you, Kal'tsit, understand the meaning of those images.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: ...The crisis destroyed everything. It cannot be visualized; there is no word in our language to describe it.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It was the end of prehistoric civilization, and the calamity that Terra must face. It is the end of all things.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The horrifying images left me as I pulled my hand back, replaced by another image. One that was broken, blurred, chaotic.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: He and His children shall devour all that is living, and consume the moons and the stars. All that is living and dead shall nourish Him, and He shall murmur at the end of time—
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'Survive.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Over and over. Survive.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'Chaotic', 'murmur'... was the Feranmut asleep?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: He was trapped within a dream. The dream stagnated, evolution stagnated, duty stagnated. He was trapped in the cerulean cave.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Therefore, I must awaken Him.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Cassia!
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Magister Avitus.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Did you and your comrades go into hiding in order to destroy the city from within? Waiting for when the Sea Patrol's guard was at its weakest?
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: You should be evacuating, Magister.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: The Sea Patrol has noticed, Cassia. They're investigating you.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: You're showing this much concern for me because that tiny embryo I left in the incubator reminded you of the past, am I right?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I'm just curious: Do you regret your decision?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Now is not the time for this.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: The Seaborn have invaded Milliarium. Stop what you're doing, or the city will be lost.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Isn't it a little late for that?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Why did you...
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Choose to betray Ægir?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I told you. The Seaborn have revealed the weakness of Ægir's very foundation. Before people can regain the will to live, the collapse of their values will have crushed them already.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Once, you were a great scholar. But what are you doing in this city now?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: You found out about me a long time ago, didn't you? You had many chances to stop things from getting to this point. You could have reported me to the Sea Patrol at any time.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: But you did nothing. You sat and waited, watching everything happen like a blind fin spinning in a whirlpool.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Did you come to Milliarium just to witness the destruction, and validate your own despair?
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: I'm not... I can still stop you.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: As long as life remains tied to any value system, it is doomed to eventually collapse. Life itself should be reason enough to live.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: We must rekindle our most basic survival instincts, and force the people to reassess the values they once held in such high regard.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Only by doing so can they be saved from despair. From becoming like you.
attributes.name: Cassia

attributes.content: Like me...
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Watch out!
(Cries and buzzes excitedly)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Hmph... Cassia got away.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: The linkage here was sabotaged. No wonder it didn't work from the control room!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: L-Leave this to me, ma'am.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The Seaborn are approaching.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: My mentor at the Inquisition taught me some Arts... although my talents are nothing to write home about.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: That woman worked at the Institute of Facility Management. She'd know how to sabotage the city unit framework...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I appreciate your courage, Jordi. I'll call in people to get this area under control. As for Cassia, she's mine.
attributes.name: Secunda

attributes.content: (Rapidly flaps fins)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Wh-Whoa! Already?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Are you going to keep lying there, Mr. Avitus?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: His student had vanished. Avitus gazes upon the young man who suddenly appeared before him. The fear in Jordi's eyes is obvious, but he lights his lantern with a trembling hand.
Jordi...
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: I heard your conversation.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You... You're not an evil man. But I'm disappointed in you. Very disappointed.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Did you come here with this city because you believed it wouldn't make it back?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: What are you hoping for? Death?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You should have returned to land sooner, Jordi.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Look around us. The Seaborn will soon overcome the barrier between the city's units. It will all come to an end, just like—
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: You never answer my questions properly!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I may end up leaving Ægir, and leaving behind all my hopes and longings, but it won't be because it's about to be destroyed.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I've read 'The Death of Life,' you know, but it didn't answer any of my questions.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Let's say all your predictions come true, and that at some point in the future we'll have no choice but to watch our homes come to the end it depicts, just like that man in the book.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But does the destruction of a civilization really weigh more than that of a city, a family, or a person, here and now?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I don't understand. I just... don't.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I wasn't sure if I should say this, but...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You said your loved one gave up on the idea of raising a child and died in disappointment. But was she disappointed in the future of Ægir, or...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: In you?
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The young Ægir musters all his strength. The lantern shakes violently, and the flickering light repels the Seaborn.
He gasps for air. Sweat rolls down his cheeks. Avitus can see his arm tremble, but if anything, it is himself who cuts a sorrier figure.
...Look out!
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: You have smeared your bodies on the outer wall, infiltrating through the trail of weapon fire before reshaping. What a convenient form of life.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Seaborn.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: (Joyfully convulses its gelatinous body)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Excitedly sways fine tentacles)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: You, here.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Nest, we, seen. From nest, you, leave. Incomprehension.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ul-pianus, kin. You, here, wait, us.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ul-pianus. Ul-pianus. No, confusion?
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Pained convulsions)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: No, need, pain.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Individual death, eternal. The many's survival, eternal.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Ul-pianus, I, lead, you. New individual, born, for you, help you... extend me...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Gladiia.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: *Cough*—Ulpianus.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: There is no expression on Gladiia's face. She holds her lance sideways, its point touching the floor.
An almost imperceptible posture, enough to mitigate the fatigue that continues to rush up from within her, and to support her as she stands before her long-absent colleague.
Your 'friend' is now a pool of goo, but you still need to answer its question.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Such rowdiness. This is really poor dance etiquette, you know?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Ha—
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Dance is an art. It's all about elegance. You can't make it work with strength of numbers.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: What? That didn't pierce it.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This used to be a cluster of coral changed by the Seaborn, but now it's a wall. No one knows how thick it is.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The warning from the city, the unusual movements of the Seaborn, the results of the abnormal surgery... We must get out of here and find out what's happening at Milliarium.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The entrance is gone?
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: No, it's us. We're losing our sense of direction.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Capsidization... Everything around us is hardening. The algal blanket, the unhatched eggs, even the waves.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: This entire nest will become a hardened shell for these creatures to store their nutrients. A shell without a single crack. There is no way the three of us can...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Even worse, the stagnating environment is exacerbating our exhaustion.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Captain Gladiia? Shark?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Behind you—
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: (Hums gently)
attributes.name: Gentle Seaborn

attributes.content: Eww.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Nest, become whole. Soon, the sea.
attributes.name: Gentle Seaborn

attributes.content: You, kin. No harm.
attributes.name: Gentle Seaborn

attributes.content: We many accept you. We many protect you.
attributes.name: Gentle Seaborn

attributes.content: Here, much nutrient. Sleep. Only sleep.
attributes.name: Gentle Seaborn

attributes.content: The lethargy, which had heretofore been suppressed by the fighting, begins to spread through every limb and organ.
The thick and hard shell solidifies the waves. All is stagnant. The Hunters vaguely sense their consciousness sinking, as though there is no bottom. The Hunters hear the song—
Coming from right beside them, coming from inside them—
'Ishar-mla.'
'The hardship we suffer is ever present.'
'The life we thirst for is ever present.'
Over there... Skadi...
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: Roaring.
The faint roar comes from above. The thundering roar comes from beside. The stagnant seawater flows again.
The infinite ocean could be bound by a cocoon. Then, from where comes the force that can break even the cocoon?
Land. Moon. The scent of wheat. Home far away.
The force has become legend. It has shattered mountains, death, time, all that is tangible and intangible—
He will not be bound.
(Loud neigh)
attributes.name: Rocinante

attributes.content: You, many, alike...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: From where...
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Hraaagh—
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: The waves, you built them, you hardened them.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Are you... turning this to land?
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Will not allow.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: Contradiction. Wilderness, mountains, rivers, wheat fields. Land is just land.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: I seek, I reproach, I crush.
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: The one who was with Ulpianus...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Whew... A pleasure to see you again, Sir Knight.
attributes.name: Specter

attributes.content: You, not kin.
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Furious roar)—!
attributes.name: The Last Knight

attributes.content: (Agitatedly twitches soft tentacles)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: (Excitedly flaps creased fins)
attributes.name: Seaborn

attributes.content: Out of the way!
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Doña Irene!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I've been looking for you.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Sorry, I...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Received Consul Clementia's message? Dr. Kal'tsit's group is headed to the port, but then we lost communications again.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: We must return to the Eye of Iberia immediately, inform Lord Carmen, and help the Inquisition and Penal Battalion form defense lines.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: No. We have to wait.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Most of the invading Seaborn are still under control near the beacon tower. If that unit can be ejected...
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Then Milliarium is not yet lost. It can even organize a counterattack.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: But the cultists have sabotaged the linkage to prevent it from being jettisoned.
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: The Sea Patrol is already cleaning up the Seaborn in the area. We can't let these slip away either.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I'll deal with them. As for whatever this linkage is you're talking about... Will your engineering skills help?
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Yes!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: I can fix it!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Good. You take the lead on that.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: I'll protect you and Avitus. We can return to land as soon as we're done.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: We worked together at the Eye of Iberia. Let's pray we do just as well this time.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: But these Seaborn from the depths are different from the ones I've dealt with on land. I don't know how long I can hold them off.
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: We've said all that needs to be said, Mr. Avitus. Come and help, if you still have the strength!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Avitus

attributes.content: Hurry, Jordi!
attributes.name: Irene

attributes.content: Hurry, Jordi Fontanarossa!
attributes.name: Jordi

attributes.content: You warned us through the beacon... And the strange knight who appeared at the lighthouse broke through the shell just as we were about to fall asleep.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Is he part of your plan too, Ulpianus?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The madman who's forgotten himself is an enemy of the sea, of everything abnormal that has become normal, and of himself.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: No one can control someone like that. We just happened to travel together.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Are you the only one to make it back?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: They're on their way.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Breaking through the nest's shell and returning through tides of Seaborn... Your speed was remarkable, but you're too late.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You've seen what's happening to Milliarium. The many have exploited Ægir, and Milliarium will be the stepping stone for their invasion of the land.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: And what, precisely, is happening here?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: The first thing I heard when I arrived at the port is that the Abyssal Hunter, Ulpianus, had entered the control room of the beacon tower and killed the weapons technology advisor of the Waterway Program.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: And indeed, Blandus's body is right behind you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: You're quiet.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I assumed you'd feel more anguish over him.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I take it you've figured him out then, judging by your reaction.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I doubt we have time to discuss a fallen traitor... even if he was once our closest comrade.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: That young man really did it.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The linkage has been repaired.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You're trying to eject the beacon tower from Milliarium... A wise plan.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It seems there's still hope for you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: This place will sink to the ocean floor in a few minutes. Do you smell it?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The stench of frenzy...The Seaborn above have noticed the changes to the tower. They're seizing the last opportunity to break the blockade and reach the other parts of Milliarium.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Leave, Gladiia. Now.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Come back to Ægir, Ulpianus. This is your last chance.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I still have things to clear up. If I give up now, all my efforts will have been for naught.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: The dreams and end of the prehistoric civilization, where the Seaborn came from, where they will go, the calamity before our eyes, the destruction beyond the skies...
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Being aware of them is not enough to turn the tides. I must learn more.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: If the Seaborn have memories, I must know every last detail of them.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: I'm not disputing that. We're back in the ocean, back in Ægir. We'll have many chances to approach the truth.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: That is your way. And I don't disapprove. But we need more approaches, more angles, in order to maximize our odds of victory.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: As you've said, I'm on another path now.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Will you still try to stop me?
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Unless my eyes deceived me, the Seaborn I just killed had evolved specifically for you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: That doesn't just mean they are trying to accept you. It means that you also...
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Correct.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Then you know well what being inside a rapidly hatching nest would mean for you, in your present state.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Answer me, Ægir. How much of your mind is still your own?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Is there even enough left for you to choose death?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: It's the only way for me to earn the trust of these scum.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: You're an outstanding Hunter, and a learned scientist. Are you really so arrogant as to believe you can control your transformation through willpower alone?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Accidents like the one during the auto-adaptive junction surgery will not happen every time.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I can't simply watch you walk down the path of destruction.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: ...You're at your limit.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: We're both experts in violence. You'll die if we fought here and now.
attributes.name: Ulpianus

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Her lance draws a cold arc through the air. Ulpianus lets loose the chains, and his massive anchor flies at Gladiia, forcing her to leap up.
The sound of the building sinking drowns out the clash of metal. Seawater and Seaborn rush into the control room.
In the last moments, Gladiia watches her erstwhile colleague stand before the darkened holographic sea chart, calmly waiting for the colorful waves to swallow him.
Your description raises many questions.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The feasibility of modifying a Feranmut into a biological ark by leveraging its habit of fostering an independent ecosystem inside its body had already been verified on Talos.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The technology used by the project was mature.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And their complex was deep in the mantle. Energy coming from the heart of the planet could support the facilities' operation for almost an eternity.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The project had more than sufficient power supply.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Why, then, did the project deep beneath the ocean 'stagnate,' as you put it, and go out of control, releasing innumerable Seaborn?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The existence of Feranmut was introverted by nature, yet He was to turn all things to nourishment for His survival. He was given meaning that did not belong to Him, and a name that did not belong to Him—Ishar-mla.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The changes They were put to were bolder, wilder, more ambitious, and more despairing. Their nature had long since exceeded the biological ark you speak of.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: For unknown reasons, however, Their subsequent actions did not follow the program.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Meaning that the project did not proceed along the planned lines, but the new direction was also interrupted?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Not entirely. He—They continue to foster new offspring within themselves.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: But the lives trapped within the Feranmut were weak. They evolved too slowly.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The new generation needed to be liberated. They needed to leave the Feranmut's body, adapt to new environments, and obtain more nutrition.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: More nutrition to be fed back to the Feranmut, so that His evolution may be accelerated.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Under normal circumstances, the organisms nurtured within a Feranmut are rarely able to venture beyond its body. Yet the aggression the Seaborn have demonstrated outside...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The modifications these Feranmuts have undergone were indeed transformative.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: So it was you, Mártus, who brought the Seaborn into the ocean, and sowed the seeds of calamity.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Seeds of calamity? No, the offspring were weak, and Ægir was strong.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The seabed was governed by a self-regulating ecosystem. Offspring that devoured the algae fields would be discovered and destroyed before they could proliferate.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: But Ægir should not have been an obstacle. Ægir should have provided aid. Fortunately, my influence in human society was still useful.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The Institute of Development Planning had already announced the deaths of the members of the fourth observation team of the mantle ruins at that time... You 'came back from the dead' just to corrupt your countrymen?!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: I held no forums, no debates, only a few sincere conversations. I helped some discover the problem, and some discover the answer.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: It was enough that they were willing to give the Seaborn an opportunity. We many will find a way out eventually.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The ecological disasters, the fallen cities, the citizens lost... How many of those were you responsible for?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Was it you who cajoled Blandus and the cultists behind him to infiltrate the Waterway Program and alter our weapon systems?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: (The nuclei within its skull spin)
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: This so-called Church of the Deep is not a formal organization, at least not in the sea.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: It needs no guidance, no leader.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Not an organization... You mean you manipulated the people's thoughts and behaviors only using their faith and tenets?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: How did you implant the ethereal concept of 'god' into them, when such absurd ideas were completely absent in Ægir?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Civilization could never truly purge the idea of primal worship. It awaits at the end of science, ready to be awakened at a moment's notice.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The Ægir you call 'cultists' do not know the truth. Each of them acts according to their own thoughts and ideals. Each faces their own questions and dilemmas.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'Selfishness and altruism.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'Flaws and perfection.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'Nature and civilization.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'Logic and unreason.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'The differences in strength and the shackles of form.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'The limitations of ethics and the future of humanity.'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: 'A manufactured truth and the beautiful cycle...'
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.options: You deceived your followers.;It was all a scam from the get-go?

attributes.content: (The nuclei within its skull spin)
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: A scam? No.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Primal worship originates from the survival instinct.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Every thread of thought by every 'cultist' ultimately leads to a single question: How to survive better.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Faith? Tenets? No, only a desire for survival.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You struggle for survival too, do you not?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.options: When you preached survival in Ægir...
Did you ever tell them whose survival you were talking about?

attributes.content: The survival of life itself.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Just as the survival of civilization inevitably involves the destruction of many more, the survival of life inevitably involves the end of many.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Many species have gone extinct due to the activity of the offspring, while they gathered nutrition for the Feranmut. I once recorded the number, only to forget it.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: For the moment Ishar-mla awakened, it had become a meaningless, insignificant number.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: The birth cries of the newborn, interwoven with the wailing of the dying...
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Songs brought Silence.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You knew the consequences of awakening the Firstborn from the very beginning. A disaster for the entire ocean, for countless species. But you show no remorse whatsoever.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: You even gave up on recording the number of sacrifices. Was it because you'd gone numb after taking so many lives?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: But numbness is no excuse for your crimes, Mártus.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The consul steps forward. Her ceremonial sword is elegant, but the light reflecting off it is chilling, cutting off the sightline of the Seaborn gazing towards you.
The Sophontheatrum. You designed the building that inspired so many of our people... myself included.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: But you stand here now, calmly explaining how you pushed Ægir into the abyss.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: I've seen images of you. A gentle, meditative observer who has the habit of constantly pushing his large glasses back up his nose.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Look at you now. Even the richest of thoughts can only be expressed by the simplistic movements of your cells.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: You still have your glasses on your neck. Is it to reminisce about old friends whom you have no right to reminisce, or to mock the dead whom you have no right to mock?
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: If you are Mártus the Ægir, then I hereby pass judgment upon the fallen.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: If you are merely Seaborn, then we'll skip the formalities.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: The organelles surrounding the Seaborn expand and parry Clementia's attack. The ceremonial sword cuts into the shadow of the coral-shaped terminal.
Mm—Gurgle.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You cut off my control of the terminal?
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: (Breathes scorching fire)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: (Howls furiously)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Emergency transmission. This is the 10th attempt—
attributes.name: Sea Patroller

attributes.content: The Seaborn have taken over the beacon tower. We cannot stop the conversion! But someone has activated the ejection protocol for that unit—good job, whoever you are!
attributes.name: Sea Patroller

attributes.content: Bio-signatures keep soaring in number. The nests are becoming one—
attributes.name: Sea Patroller

attributes.content: Incoming Seaborn tide! Scope is the entire continental shelf! Repeat, incoming Seaborn tide! Scope is the entire continental shelf!
attributes.name: Sea Patroller

attributes.content: Emergency transmission. This is the 11th attempt—
attributes.name: Sea Patroller

attributes.content: This is Consul Clementia. Citizens of Milliarium, heed me!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Once the city unit containing the beacon tower has been fully ejected, the rest of the city shall break through the Seaborn encirclement and move towards dry land!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Reactivate the linkage mechanism in the city's framework and perform a structural reorganization. Force fields at full power! We'll stop the Seaborn tide from setting a single tentacle onto land!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: Legions VIII and X, along with the Sea Patrol: send all operational warships out in turn to escort the city!
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: May Ægir and our forefathers be with you.
attributes.name: Clementia

attributes.content: You were looking for an opportunity this whole time... consul of Ægir.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: You're tough.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: We... too. Once.
attributes.name: 'Seaborn'

attributes.content: Is it Ægir or the Seaborn who are trying to open up a Waterway? The readings are off the charts. The endless Seaborn tide is approaching us at the very moment...
attributes.name: Inquisition Clerk

attributes.content: This is beyond the lighthouse's computational capacity!
attributes.name: Inquisition Clerk

attributes.content: Su Santidad?
attributes.name: Inquisition Clerk

attributes.content: I hear you.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Look in front of you.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Those deep colors between the sea and sky are a tide of Seaborn.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: The wind grows quiet... There is no point in trying to estimate their numbers and scope now.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Experience is better than data. I've seen the ocean like this before.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Do you mean the... the Profound Silence?
attributes.name: Inquisition Clerk

attributes.content: Leave the rest to the Penal Battalion and the Inquisitors.
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: R-Report!
attributes.name: Penal Battalion Soldier

attributes.content: Two divisions are ready for action. Ægirian drone matrices are helping us fine-tune our defenses.
attributes.name: Penal Battalion Soldier

attributes.content: Ægir...
attributes.name: Saint Carmen

attributes.content: Sir... the ocean... Something's rising from it.
attributes.name: Inquisition Clerk

attributes.content: Is that... an Ægirian city?
attributes.name: Inquisition Clerk

attributes.content: Having sailed for thousands of miles, Milliarium rises to the surface of the ocean after casting out its heart.

Every inch of it is being reformed, supported by its framework. An invisible forcefield extends towards the bottom of the sea and the highest reaches of the sky, forming a structure like a great wall.
The structure breaks the surface of the ocean, creating a giant wave a hundred meters tall. However, on the other side of the city, the real tide has arrived—
It is a living wave. Seaborn of various forms have fused with the ocean. The children of the sea are the sea itself; they have even changed the color of the water.
The city from the depths and the roiling tide stretch out at the same time, colliding, embracing, and ripping at each others' throats.
Nature never tires, yet civilization will not stop its footsteps.
All is quiet. No wind dares tell of what it sees, here and now.
